oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Document box
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two-piece pine box with bowed lid. Placed inside the lid is an engraving of George Washington on his deathbed artwork appears to have been glued to the lid's underside at later time. The box has a leather cover and cut brads. The name William Andrew McCue is associated with the piece. McCue was a Confefderate soldier from Virginia.
